results.title: Hard work and hope: Australia's Italians
results.creator_credit: Italian Historical Society and Equality Press
results.brief_description: Designed to enable Australian Studies students appreciate the role of migrant labour in Australia. Focuses on the theme of work as experienced by Italian immigrants both before and after World War II. Photographs, newsreel footage and moving footage from the Italian Historical Society documents the contribution of Australia’s Italians to the community through their work. Accompanied by a 19p. Teacher’s Guide.

results.title: Hard work
results.brief_description: A film about Margo St. James and her fight to have prostitution decriminalized. Revolving around the Hooker’s Convention in Washington, D.C., the action takes place over a five-day period. It includes a visit to the Women’s Detention Center, TV and press interviews, a congressional cocktail party, the Hooker’s Ball and a sunrise walk around the White House. It is not a didactic study on the problem of prostitution but a thought and discussion-provoking vehicle that probes the moral and social values involved.

results.title: Hard water
results.creator_credit: View Point, Unilever Films, Michael Clarke and Peter Griffiths
results.brief_description: Rain falling to earth as a weak acid reaches the tap as a solution of ionic compounds. Soap reacts with these compounds to form insoluble calcium soap, precipitated as scum, while soapless detergents form soluble acid salts. Gives an explanation of water softening by ion exchange.

results.title: Hard to windward
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Government Film Unit, Norman Laird and Max Graham
results.brief_description: The Sydney-Hobart Yacht Race, Starting every year on Boxing Day. Shows the start in Sydney Harbour, following one boat through the race to the finish on the River Derwent, and celebrations and prize giving which follow.

results.title: Hard target
results.creator_credit: Alphaville, Renaissance Productions, James Jacks, Sean Daniel and John Woo
results.brief_description: Chance Boudreaux (Jean Claude Van Damme) is a down on his luck Cajun soldier, reluctantly hired by Nat Binder (Yancy Butler) to help find her father, an ex Green Beret who is currently homeless in Louisiana. What they both don’t know is that their mission is doomed to fail, as Nat’s father has been brutally murdered as sport. His killer is the ruthless Fouchon (Lance Henriksen), a mercenary who procures homeless people living around New Orleans and enlists them in his game, whereby they become the live targets. This film features enough of John Woo’s trademark action and Jean Claude Van Damme’s physical presence to satisy Woo and JCVD fans.

results.title: Hard soldering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.

results.title: Hard rubbish
results.brief_description:
A look at everyday life in one community and how it transforms waste into a valuable commodity, from one individual’s discarded object to another’s newly claimed prize possession. Several residents offer their personal insights to curbside recycling or as one discerning person calls it “free-ranging rubbish”, adding that there is a definite rubbish etiquette to be followed.
Music composed and performed by Irma Frieda.

results.title: Hard oil! How the Canadians discovered oil
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Springbett, Brian Arnott, Don Hopkins and Nicholas Kendall
results.brief_description: The story of the early Canadian oil industry from its start in Petrolia and Oil Springs, Ontario, from about 1850 to 1900. Dramatic re-creations blend with archival photographs and diaries to tell the rags-to-riches-to-rags tale of a boom that went bust. Voice and narration by Max Ferguson, Allan McFee.

results.title: Hard knocks
results.creator_credit: Andromeda Productions, Hilton Bonner and Don McLennan
results.brief_description: A young girl, with a background of urban poverty and juvenile crime, attempts to become a fashion model. The hypocrisy and double standards of society are juxtaposed against the confusion and frustration she feels as she struggles to become part of a community that has no place for her.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andromeda Productions, Hilton Bonner and Don McLennan

results.title: Hard core logo = Hardcore logo
results.creator_credit: Terminal City Pictures, Shadow Shows, Christine Heabler, Brian Dennis and Bruce McDonald
results.brief_description: This comic mockumentary about a punk band that embarks on a disastrous final comeback tour, begs comparison to the seminal rock-mockumentary “This is Spinal Tap” (1983). Yet while both films mime the cliches of the rock and roll lifestyle with hilarious results, “Hard Core Logo” is less of an out-and-out farce than its predecessor. Its tongue-in-cheek exploration of small time rock celebrity and friendship gone sour, is tinged by a darker, ruder, more nihlistic undertone characteristic of punk rock’s ethos. After re-uniting for a benefit performance fifteen years after their acrimonious breakup, the members of legendary Vancouver punk rock band Hard Core Logo decide to do one last farewell tour across western Canada, accompanied by a documentary film crew. As soon as they hit the road the hostilities between the egomaniacal lead singer and the charismatic guitarist - the only band member with a future in music - that originally split the band quickly rise to the surface again. Meanwhile having forgotten his medication, the bass player is struggling with his mental stability, while Pipefitter, the redneck stoned drummer, is oblivious to everything. Predictably the tour soon declines into melodrama and ultimately, tragedy. Cast includes Hugh Dillon, Callum Keith Rennie, Bernie Coulson, John Pyper-Ferguson.
